Directives: checkbox-field

checkbox-field

checkbox-field(attribute, disable, help, label)

Renders a checkbox <input> with optional label. This type of component is well-suited for boolean attributes.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
attribute String

Name of the attribute within the parent form-for directive's model object. This attributes specifies the data-binding target for the input. Dot notation (ex "address.street") is supported.
disable Boolean

Disable input element. (Note the name is disable and not disabled to avoid collisions with the HTML5 disabled attribute).
help String

Optional help tooltip to display on hover. By default this makes use of the Angular Bootstrap tooltip directive and the Font Awesome icon set.
label String

Optional field label displayed after the checkbox input. (Although not required, it is strongly suggested that you specify a value for this attribute.) HTML is allowed for this attribute.
Source:
  • directives/checkbox-field.js, line 1
Example
// To display a simple TOS checkbox you might use the following markup:
<checkbox-field label="I agree with the TOS"
                attribute="accepted">
</checkbox-field>
